page.title: 17TRANSPORT IN LITTLE BADDOW
page.content: As an area with a population of 2000 in 1985 Little Baddow suffers from a lack of modern communication facilities. This is largely due to the villages proximaty to the city of Chelmsford and the unfortunate cuts in public spending. Many people do in fact have their own private arrangements for travel in the area and most residents in the village possess their own cars. The highways, however, are narrow and roads in the low lying areas are liable to flood. Public transport is severely limited as there is no rail connection and the buses are infrequent except for specially arranged school buses. If you own a horse, however, then you will be well catered for as there are an abundance of bridleways and country paths on which to ride.
